title: 2011 Hazfi Cup Final
text:
The 2011 Hazfi Cup Final was a <a href="Two-legged%20tie">two-legged</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> tie in order to determine the <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20Hazfi%20Cup">2010–11 Hazfi Cup</a> champion of <a href="Iran">Iran</a>ian football clubs. <a href="Persepolis%20F.C.">Persepolis</a> faced <a href="Malavan%20F.C.">Malavan</a> in this final game. The first leg took place on June 7, 2011 at 19:45 <a href="Iran%20Standard%20Time">IRDT</a> () at <a href="Azadi%20Stadium">Azadi Stadium</a> in <a href="Tehran">Tehran</a> and the second leg took place on June 10, 2011 at 17:00 <a href="Iran%20Standard%20Time">local time</a> () at Takhti Stadium, <a href="Bandar%20Anzali">Bandar Anzali</a>.
Format.
The rules for the final were exactly the same as the one for the previous knockout rounds. The tie was contested over two legs with <a href="Away%20goals%20rule">away goals</a> deciding the winner if the two teams were level on goals after the second leg. If the teams could still not be separated at that stage, then <a href="extra%20time">extra time</a> would have been played with a <a href="Penalty%20shootout%20%28association%20football%29">penalty shootout</a> (taking place if the teams were still level after that).
